channel.title: A question for someone who knows scar well
channel.description: k i wanna know how you can tell the script how many times to repeat a thing for example how many time to repeat a procedure in the main loop. if possible can you use example while explaining i am new and i only have made 3 simple scripts plz help ty :)

item.title: A question for someone who knows scar well
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

To explain while do, and repeat until, I’ll post some examples.

while i = 1 do begin Do; Some; Stuff; end;

The i = 1 part can be anything, true = true, false = true, 1 = 3 ect.

repeat
  Do;
  Stuff;
until(Condition is met)

The Condition is met part can be anything, one example is until(False) witch is repeating forever, but you shouldn’t use this, but you could use say “repeat until(findbitmap(…))”, or “repeat until(1 = 2)” ect.

Read full topic
item.source: A question for someone who knows scar well

item.title: A question for someone who knows scar well
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

wickedboy141:

ty so much

Yep, no problem. You could do a while do, or a repeat until loop, but the efficiency, and cleanliness of the loop doesn’t compare to a for do.

item.dc:creator: @wickedboy141 wickedboy141
item.source: A question for someone who knows scar well

item.title: A question for someone who knows scar well
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[code]var i : integer;

const HowManyRepeats = 5;

begin
for i := 1 to HowManyRepeats do
begin
DoStuff;
end;
end.[/code]
There are other ways, but that one is my favourite.

Read full topic
